reviewText:
This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer.
ZombieRun is an action platformer that has it's problems.

The screenshots and information shown on the store page for this game initially had me very interested, I haven't seen many platformers take on the theme of Zombies before so was eager to play. As with all other platforming games;  I plugged in my Xbox controller and sat back in my chair to play. Sadly upon loading up, I was faced with my first problem; I was unable to navigate through the main menu with the controller. While this isn't a massive issue, it is the sort of thing I have come to expect from games like this, especially when they are marked as Full controller" support on their store page.

I navigated through all the menu options as I always do
date: wanting to check out the controls
recommended: this is where I found my second issue. The controller page is just horrendously messy.  I didn't know what actions were referring to which buttons
hoursPlayed: it was just all over the place. This option may as well be taken out as it stands as it will be no use to anybody
voteText: other than a hindrance.\n\nSo I start the game
helpfulPercent: thinking the controls can't be that hard to figure out as I can always test buttons as soon as I am in the game. NOPE
votesHelpful: as soon as you load into the first level
votesTotal: you have to effectively move out of the way of an enemy more or less straight away otherwise you die. While you may not think this is a problem
commentsCount: especially when the controller doesn't work...sadly it is just not me who has the problem
column16: many people online are also complaining of it too. I'm sure you know
column17: playing a platformer game with keyboard is challenging at it's best
column19: sadly again the controls were even more of an issue. In order to move around you have to use the arrow keys
column20: and you shoot with your WASD keys
column21: who'd a thought it? This to me is completely backwards.\n\nThe actual game play is very basic too; this may as well call it self a rogue-like too
column22: because you only have one life and if you get hit by a zombie
column23: you go right back to the start; it's brutally hard. I managed to clear a few levels before managing the controls and completing jumping puzzles became too much of an issue.\n\nSo in conclusion
column24: ZombieRun has major controller issues which virtually makes the game unplayable after the first few levels
column25: and even though it's a really cheap game
column26: you'll still feel ripped off if you pick it up and try it.\n\nIf you found this review helpful
column27: please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/\n\nhttp://store.steampowered.com/app/358840"

reviewText: I always buy 4 player games to play with my boys (sons) we love anything split screen. So when I saw this game I thought split screen, 4 players, and zombies all the things a game is comprised of to be good.......Wrong!!! So the first thing and the worst thing is the controls we on Xbox controllers it didn't work it says you can configure but it wouldn't so I haven't actually played the game yet. So if you play solo I guess it's a good game but I refuse to do so until they fix this problem maybe the next update.

reviewText: This game has potential. The Developer has poor execution, in my mind. The controls are VERY BAD if you try to use a controller. The keyboard controls are ok at best. It suffers from a lot of Bugs/ Collider issues. The background sprites are slightly off and you can see tears in the background, which are distracting.

reviewText: A simple platformer where you run through levels by shooting zombies and jumping on platforms to get to the end. Unfortunately the game is a bit lacking. It gets rather boring and frustrating fast, especially when you encounter spikes. Their hitbox" is bigger than the spikes make it look
date: got me really frustrated on a level. If you hit a spike (or fall off of platforms or hit a zombie) you go to the last checkpoint. There aren't that many of them so most of the time the checkpoint is the beginning of the level. Anyways
recommended:
below average for sure I'd say.

Lil' Sucky Gameplay to go with the review.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D4VV6m2ReZg"

reviewText:
Overall - 1.5/5 - REALLY NOT A BARGAIN
Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend ZombieRun to fellow Steam gamers. At $3.29 Cdn the price is too high for such a simple, aesthetically-limited, slightly-bugged game. It also suffers serious controller issues for a platformer. Add in a lack of any DLC (new characters to play as would have been nice), and gamers will do well to hold onto their Steam change for another title.

Read the full review of this title and more at Budget Gaming Review!
http://budgetgaming.blogspot.ca/2015/06/zombierun.html

reviewText:
I GOT THIS AS A FREE KEY ON REDDIT~!

While the game is nice in terms of retro styling, the inability to change resolution is a huge drawback.  There is no distinct warning for danger, and the controls are a little clunky.  I really wanted this to be  better than it was.  I apologize to the developer for the bad review but  I really can't endorse it.

You will probably notice that there is no almost no time played on my account for this game but that is just because i played in steam offline mode an a different computer because of the ridiculously absurd fact that you need to download java to run this game.

I gace it like an hour and a half to prove itself worthy but Sorry but this gets a thumbs down.

reviewText: I guess this is some bundle game I got.. Or at least I hope I didn't spend any money on this. Terrible sounds and no story. Some hitboxes were totally nightmares. The game took less than hour to complete solo but there's not a chance I would spend anymore time to find hidden paths" or play with co-op. I like to complete games but if this would have been longer it wouldn't have happened."

reviewText: It's a fun game for killing time but I wouldn't invest a lot into it. The menus aren't that good in the game, I have to force close the game to shut it down. The Xbox controller support isn't there even though it says it was fixed in the latest update. I got this game in a bundle and can enjoy it from time to time. I'd say if you're interested in it, get this game while it's in a bundle or on sale. I wouldn't pay the asking price for it, maybe $1.

reviewText:
It's just Mario with a bunch of zombies and annoying voice clips.

I found myself mildly amused while playing this but I couldn't get past more than 3 levels before it became boring. The carrot and apple abilities dont really help much, you can actually just play without them and die constantly to stock up on them. The zombies aren't even a threat you can just hop over them all, no biggie.
It was alright while it lasted but it became too repetitive too soon.
